instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message:
Hello
I have this board after water damage.
After my repair board works but with one problem.
Fan runs at high speed.
Could anybody have any suggest?
Trackpad changed
I/O Board Changed
WiFi Card changed
SMC Changed from Working Board
All corroded elements are tested, (all which i saw)

Kindly Regards Mariusz

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message: Run EFI version of ASD to check for sensor errors. Also I do not see trackpad cable in your list of replaced parts..

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message:
I dont have asd for this model (early 2015)
When I use Diagnostic its show me SMC/Power Problem
Trackpad flex changed

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message: What is the exact error code?

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message:
This is diagnostic without ssd
Reference Code: PFM006
AND PPN001

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message: That is pretty classic for the trackpad sensor. Where was the liquid damage and what was done to the board? Was the SMC from the exact same board?

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message:
I tested it in working top case.
Board has not turning on with battery and that was R7150 problem.
Was water damaged SMC area - some pads and resistors repaired/changed.
SMC i took from new board, number same but different processor.

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message: Pin 16 and 17 on the trackpad connector carry the data for the sensor. Inspect the connector for corrosion and measure the data lines on diode mode.

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message: Was the SMC replaced because of this issue or something else?

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message: I changed SMC because  of this problem.

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message: Install iStat or some other temperature utility and see if any sensor read weird or are missing.

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message: All temp. are fine ~24-35˚C

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message: Is the machine also lagging or is it running fine?

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message: No, its working fine. Only fan is spinning

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message:
Now I Have some new information from ISTAT.
I solder old SMC

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message: Looks fine. Is it also seeing the fan RPM correctly?

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message:
RPM is ok ~6000rpm
I worry about Wifi - shows ~40C but isn't more hot that rest of board.
I changed it but without good results.
Now i stuck with this repair.
I have next similar repair but with older mac(mid 2014). Maybe I'm doing something wrong. Maybe this is cleaning problem.
Please look ASD log

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message: With that board there is an issue on SMBUS_SMC_3, all sensors that are failing are connected to that data bus. I bet corrosion in the trackpad connector or crap under SMC.

threads.title: 820-00165 Fan spinning high
threads.message:
Ok, problem solved.
R5805 have 8 Ohm and should be 0 Ohm
Thanks for helping.
